Package com.pizzeria.training.controllers

Class OrderController

java.lang.Object
com.pizzeria.training.controllers.OrderController
@RestController
@CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:3000")
@RequestMapping("/orders")
public class OrderController
extends java.lang.Object
REST Controller class for Order object to interact with mongoDB database

    • getOrders

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Order>> getOrders​(@RequestParam(required=false) org.bson.types.ObjectId _id, @RequestParam(required=false) org.bson.types.ObjectId cust_id, @RequestParam(required=false) java.lang.String email) throws javax.security.auth.login.AccountNotFoundException
      Get method for all orders in the database
      Parameters:
      _id - Optional parameter to filter by order Id
      _id - Optional parameter to filter by customer id
      Returns:
      List of all orders in the database

    • getAllOrdersByExample

      @PostMapping("/examples") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Order>> getAllOrdersByExample​(@RequestBody Order order)
      Get method for orders using an example order object
      Parameters:
      order - The order to be used as an example
      Returns:
      Orders matching the given example

    • updateOrder

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<? extends java.lang.Object> updateOrder​(@RequestParam org.bson.types.ObjectId _id, @RequestBody Order updateOrder) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Put method for updating order information
      Parameters:
      _id - MongoDB document Id to identify order to edit
      updateOrder - New order object to replace the one currently under the Id
      Returns:
      Saves updated order in the database
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • deleteOrder

      _id - The Id of the order to be deleted
